nodes.name: pacta-sunt-servanda
nodes.description: Agreements must be kept - the foundational principle of contract law
nodes.application_context: Binding force of contracts between parties

nodes.name: consensus-ad-idem
nodes.description: Meeting of the minds - parties must have mutual agreement

nodes.name: exceptio-non-adimpleti-contractus
nodes.description: Exception of non-performance - a party need not perform if the other has not

nodes.name: consideration-exists
nodes.description: Valid contracts require consideration or quid pro quo
nodes.application_context: Contract formation in common law jurisdictions

nodes.name: nemo-plus-iuris
nodes.description: No one can transfer more rights than they have

nodes.name: nemo-dat-quod-non-habet
nodes.description: No one gives what they do not have

nodes.name: res-nullius
nodes.description: A thing belonging to no one - can be acquired by occupation

nodes.name: audi-alteram-partem
nodes.description: Hear the other side - fundamental principle of natural justice
nodes.application_context: Fair hearing rights in all proceedings

nodes.name: nemo-iudex-in-causa-sua
nodes.description: No one should be a judge in their own cause

nodes.name: ei-qui-affirmat-non-ei-qui-negat-incumbit-probatio
nodes.description: The burden of proof lies on the one who affirms, not on the one who denies

nodes.name: expressio-unius-est-exclusio-alterius
nodes.description: Express mention of one thing excludes others

nodes.name: nullum-crimen-sine-lege
nodes.description: No crime without law - acts cannot be criminal unless prohibited by law
nodes.provenance: Enlightenment legal philosophy, international human rights
nodes.application_context: Principle of legality in criminal law

nodes.name: nulla-poena-sine-lege
nodes.description: No punishment without law - punishment must be prescribed by law
nodes.provenance: Enlightenment legal philosophy, international human rights

nodes.name: in-dubio-pro-reo
nodes.description: When in doubt, for the accused - presumption of innocence
nodes.application_context: Criminal trials and burden of proof

nodes.name: actus-non-facit-reum-nisi-mens-sit-rea
nodes.description: An act does not make one guilty unless the mind is guilty - requires both actus reus and mens rea

nodes.name: damnum-injuria-datum
nodes.description: Loss wrongfully caused - basis of delictual liability

nodes.name: volenti-non-fit-injuria
nodes.description: No injury is done to one who consents
nodes.application_context: Defense to liability based on consent

nodes.name: culpa
nodes.description: Fault or negligence - required element for liability

nodes.name: res-ipsa-loquitur
nodes.description: The thing speaks for itself - doctrine of negligence

nodes.name: supremacy-of-constitution
nodes.description: The constitution is supreme and all law must conform to it

nodes.name: rule-of-law
nodes.description: Everyone is subject to the law and equal before it

nodes.name: separation-of-powers
nodes.description: Division of government into legislative, executive, and judicial branches

nodes.name: ubuntu
nodes.description: Humanity towards others - African philosophy of interconnectedness
nodes.provenance: African customary law, South African Constitution

nodes.name: legality
nodes.description: Administrative action must be authorized by law

nodes.name: rationality
nodes.description: Administrative decisions must be rational and reasonable

nodes.name: procedural-fairness
nodes.description: Fair procedures must be followed in administrative action

nodes.name: legitimate-expectation
nodes.description: Reasonable expectations created by authorities should be protected

nodes.name: equity-will-not-suffer-a-wrong-without-remedy
nodes.description: Equity provides remedies where common law fails

nodes.name: he-who-seeks-equity-must-do-equity
nodes.description: One seeking equitable relief must act fairly

nodes.name: equity-follows-the-law
nodes.description: Equitable principles supplement but do not contradict law

nodes.name: onus-probandi
nodes.description: Burden of proof - party asserting must prove

nodes.name: best-evidence-rule
nodes.description: Original evidence is preferred over secondary evidence

nodes.name: relevance
nodes.description: Evidence must be relevant to the matter at issue

nodes.name: literal-rule
nodes.description: Words in statutes should be given their ordinary meaning

nodes.name: golden-rule
nodes.description: Literal interpretation unless it leads to absurdity

nodes.name: mischief-rule
nodes.description: Interpret to suppress the mischief and advance the remedy

nodes.name: purposive-approach
nodes.description: Interpret statutes according to their purpose and spirit

nodes.name: tempus-regit-actum
nodes.description: Time governs the act - law in force at the time governs

nodes.name: prescription
nodes.description: Rights can be lost through passage of time and inaction

nodes.name: laches
nodes.description: Unreasonable delay can bar equitable relief
nodes.application_context: Delay as bar to equitable remedies

nodes.name: specific-performance
nodes.description: Actual performance of contractual obligation may be ordered
nodes.application_context: Equitable remedy for breach of contract

nodes.name: injunction
nodes.description: Court order to do or refrain from doing something

nodes.name: ubi-ius-ibi-remedium
nodes.description: Where there is a right, there is a remedy

nodes.name: doli-incapax
nodes.description: Incapable of crime - children under certain age presumed incapable

nodes.name: compos-mentis
nodes.description: Of sound mind - legal capacity requires mental competence

nodes.name: bona-fides
nodes.description: Good faith - acting honestly and fairly
nodes.application_context: Standard of conduct in legal relations

nodes.name: contra-bonos-mores
nodes.description: Against good morals - unlawful conduct violating community values

nodes.name: ex-turpi-causa-non-oritur-actio
nodes.description: From a dishonourable cause, no action arises

nodes.name: uberrima-fides
nodes.description: Utmost good faith - highest standard of honesty
nodes.application_context: Duty of disclosure in insurance contracts

nodes.name: qui-facit-per-alium-facit-per-se
nodes.description: He who acts through another acts himself - vicarious liability

nodes.name: respondeat-superior
nodes.description: Let the master answer - employer liability for employee acts

nodes.name: causa-sine-qua-non
nodes.description: Cause without which not - but-for test of causation

nodes.name: novus-actus-interveniens
nodes.description: New intervening act - breaks chain of causation

nodes.name: proportionality
nodes.description: Measures must be proportionate to their objectives
nodes.application_context: Limitation of rights and administrative action

nodes.name: subsidiarity
nodes.description: Decisions should be made at the most local level possible
nodes.application_context: Allocation of powers in multi-level governance

nodes.name: non-refoulement
nodes.description: Prohibition on returning refugees to danger

nodes.name: jus-cogens
nodes.description: Peremptory norms of international law from which no derogation is permitted
nodes.provenance: Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties

nodes.name: pacta-tertiis-nec-nocent-nec-prosunt
nodes.description: Treaties neither harm nor benefit third parties
nodes.application_context: Effect of treaties on third states
